With March Madness behind us, the betting world is ready for Augusta, and that means examining the **2021 Masters odds** from two perspectives. The sportsbooks and our Golf Model. Our Model, which we go into more detail on down the bottom, was developed by one of the sharpest sports betting data scientists in the world. In this article, we'll share: * Who suits Augusta * The Masters Odds * The Predictions from our PGA Model * Where the betting value is * Who we're backing to win the 2021 Masters * What props we're betting on too All your betting needs are covered, using the most up to date data sources and a sharp betting model. - - - ## **Augusta Angles** Before we share the models picks, here's the Course Fit Tool from DataGolf to remind you who suits Augusta: ![the masters odds course fit tool](/images/uploads/screen-shot-2021-03-12-at-3.14.22-pm.png "the masters odds course fit tool") When you put the relative importance filter on, you're asking for a strong short game, good irons, and big driving. Basically the total package. But you can see that if you're off with the stick and the wedge, you won't be wearing green on Sunday. - - - ## **2021 Masters Odds** As you'll soon see, odds are everything. We look for value when we bet. Which is players that are much shorter on our Golf Model than the sportsbooks. The greater the difference in odds, the better the bet. What stands out at The Masters, is that sportsbooks opinions vary. And if you shop around for the top odds, you can make a case to back multiple players at great odds. We'll share those shortly, but take a look at the Top 16 players, and how their odds vary: ![masters odds 2021](/images/uploads/masters-odds-2021.png "masters odds 2021") Why 16 players? Well, we were tight for room, and wanted to include Webb Simpson. We recommended Webb at 40-1 weeks ago and you can still see the same odds. - - - ## **2021 Masters Predictions** Finally, let's examine the predictions from our Golf Model:
So where is the value this week? Well we compare it to [Odds Boom](https://www.oddsboom.com/golf/futures/1990-masters/) for the US sportsbook prices. - - -
**WANT THE BEST ODDS FOR THE MASTERS? JOIN POINTSBET**
- - - ## **2021 Masters Picks** As you can see from the outputs, the Model has Jon Rahm on top. Narrowly ahead of the defending champion, **Dustin Johnson**. First thing to note, the Model doesn't realise that big Roger Rahmjet had a kid this week. Now, will he play with the freedom of a man with higher priorities or will he play like a sleep deprived foreign father away from his wife and son? Caesars is betting the latter as they have him the best odds in the world, at +1400. That's a bet according to our Model. Looking at the other favorites, you may have noticed the Model doesn't quite rate DJ as high as the sportsbooks. And the Model isn't buying **Speeeeef** tickets, despite the incredible comeback form. **Bryson and JT**, are similarly under the odds. The Model, as usual, loves the look of some familiar names, beyond Rahm. **Xander Schauffele**, **Patrick Cantlay** and **Webb Simpson**. Painfully, it found similar blokes last year. But we ride or die with the Model. Developed by one of the sharpest sports betting data scientists on the planet, we stay true. Lets examine the full list of players that are over the market odds and provide value bets (favorite bets in **bold**): * Jon Rahm (11-1 Model vs 14-1 Caesars) * Xander Schauffele (21-1 Model vs 26-1 Unibet / DraftKings) * Patrick Cantlay (21-1 Model vs 22-1 William Hill / FoxBet / PointsBet) * Webb Simpson (24-1 Model vs 40-1 PointsBet / FoxBet) * Patrick Reed (34-1 Model vs 40-1 FoxBet) * Tony Finau (34-1 Model vs 40-1 FoxBet / PointsBet) * Hideki Matsuyama (49-1 vs 60-1 PointsBet) * Matthew Fitzpatrick (47-1 vs 60-1 FoxBet) * Scottie Scheffler (54-1 vs 60-1 FoxBet / PointsBet) * Tyrrell Hatton (55-1 vs 60-1 FoxBet / PointsBet) * Adam Scott (69-1 vs 80-1 FoxBet) * Louis Oosthuizen (63-1 vs 90-1 FanDuel) * Abraham Ancer (79-1 vs 125-1 Caesars) * Corey Conners (81-1 vs 125-1 PointsBet / FoxBet) * Justin Rose (90-1 vs 125-1 PointsBet) * Billy Horschel (105-1 vs 125-1 PointsBet / FoxBet) * Shane Lowry (120-1 vs 175-1 FoxBet) Now that's a tonne of bets. If you love any of these guys, the Model supports you. Just shop for best odds as indicated. But we're going to throw another lense over these picks. We'll compare the market and model outputs to Betfair. That way we get wisdom of the crowds and the wisdom of market moving, sharp sports bettors. The players that Betfair also likes, from above are: * Jon Rahm * Patrick Reed * Matthew Fitzpatrick * Tyrrell Hatton - - - ## **Final 2021 Masters Picks** All said and done, here are our final WIN bets for the 2021 Masters: * **Jon Rahm 2 units at 14-1 w/Caesars** * **Webb Simpson 1 unit at 40-1 w/FoxBet** * **Patrick Reed 1 unit at 40-1 w/FoxBet** * **Matthew Fitzpatrick 0.5 units at 60-1 w/FoxBet** * **Corey Conners 0.3 units at 125-1 w/PointsBet or FoxBet** Let's also pick off some prop bets. - - - ## **Prop Bets** With the props, we're going to find group matchups when the Ratings from the Model are wildly different than the market. Specifically, we're going to find players that the market loves, that the Model doesn't. The perfect example is **Jordan Spieth**. Again, we absolutely love his comeback momentum but we're happy to bet against someone that just lifted a massive monkey off their back. Plus, history is with the Model as only two players have gone on to win a Masters after winning the weekend prior. We'll back against Spieth in two tournament matchups: * 1 unit Jon Rahm at +105 at FoxBet * 2 units Justin Thomas -142 at FanDuel We're also going to take on **Bryson**. * 2 units on DJ to beat Bryson -110 at FoxBet * 1 unit Justin Thomas +100 at Bet365 Nervously, we'll back Xander vs **Brooks** too. Xander is twice as likely to win the Masters as Brooks, according to the Model: * 1.5 units on Xander to beat Brooks at -111 at FoxBet **Top Senior: Fred Couples** Great bet at +750 for 2 units. Lefty is a deserving favorite but -110 is just under the odds and Fred can still play. **Top English: Tyrrell Hatton** Bet365 for 2 units at +600. Model has him as good as any of the other Poms but great price sticking out at 365. **Top Aussie: Adam Scott** Cam Smith could seriously shock the world and win the whole thing but Scotty is the value here. Just behind Cam on the prediction list but +335 with Unibet or SugarHouse. That's a bet for 2 units. That's it ladies and gentlemen. Bet well and enjoy the show. - - -
**WANT THE BEST ODDS FOR THE MASTERS? YOU NEED POINTSBET**
- - - ## **Why Should I Care About Your Model?** Glad you asked. Firstly, our chief data scientist is no joke. He makes a healthy living by betting off his sports models. His most recent, our golf model, uses the last 15 years of data to produce win predictions for PGA tournaments. The model can be broken down into three stages: 1. **Historic score adjustment** Firstly, historic golf scores are adjusted to account for varying course difficulty and conditions on the day. For example a "-2" on a certain course/day combination may be an average score but on another course/day combination it might be a great score due to the course being more difficult and/or unfavorable conditions. This adjustment is necessary so that we can compare players on a like for like basis. 2. **Score prediction** We then create features using the adjusted historic scores and run a few machine learning algorithms on top of these, weighting each equally. These provide an accurate prediction for the most likely score that a player will achieve on an average course in the future. 3. **Simulation** Using these future score predictions, for a given tournament we can then simulate each player's score using their own score distribution to come up with win percentages and fair odds for each player in a tournament. - - - ## **More Golf Betting Expertise** If you love betting on golf like us, check out our **[Top 50 World Golf Rankings](https://www.betrefinery.com/golf-betting/world-golf-rankings)**. We update them every week. Plus we have a **[How To Bet On Golf Guide](https://www.betrefinery.com/golf-betting/how-to-bet-on-golf)** that we think you'll love too. Whilst we might play off 22 when we go around the course, our golf betting is off scratch.
